intro: Triolena pileoides subsp. pileoides, commonly known as the slender triolena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
